H0.text: The Sun is the primary source of the gravitational pull that causes most tides on Earth.

H1.text: Stars are the celestial bodies whose gravitational pull mostly causes tides on Earth.

H2.text: The Moon is the gravitational pull that mostly causes tides on Earth.

H3.text: Asteroids are the gravitational pull that mostly causes tides on Earth.

A4.text: While the Moon exerts most of the tidal forces, the Sun also exerts tidal forces and therefore contributes to the tides as much as 40% of the Moon's tidal force; producing in interplay the spring and neap tides.

A5.text: The Sun also exerts tidal forces and therefore contributes to the tides as much as 40% of the Moon's tidal force.
